results.title: Waverley steps: a visit to Edinburgh
results.creator_credit: John Eldridge, Paul Fletcher and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: A description of Edinburgh, past and present. The film attempts more to convey the atmosphere of the city than to give a straight description of its outstanding features.

results.title: Wave velocities, dispersion and the omega beta diagram (TEFC
results.brief_description: Theodore Van Duger of the University of California, Berkley, shows that a prediction of the action of complex waves can be determined if it is known how its sine wave components propagate along the same system. The film studies the propagation and superposition of complex waves in a barrier system.

results.title: Wave twisters
results.creator_credit: Eric Henry, Syd Garon, Yoga Frog and Thud Rumble Ltd
results.brief_description: A mind bending film that melds 3D and 2D animation, science fiction, 20th century pop culture, and, most prominently, hip-hop. “Wave twisters” was the idea of superstar hip-hop DJ Qbert, who created an album, “Wave twisters”, which he hoped to fashion into a film of sorts. Three years later it became a reality with this film that is set entirely to the soundtrack of his album. The story joins the Inter Dental Space Commander and his assistants, Honey and Rubbish, who are having a messy day at work when their spaceship comes under attack from the thuggish Redworm. The Dental Space Commander and his assistants escape with the prized artefact the Wave Twister, which came from the hip-hop planet Quasar 16.33.45.78. The band of heroes, with B-Boy Grandpa, go to the planet hoping to revive the lost arts of hip-hop (scratching, rapping, breakdancing, and graffiti) which has been outlawed by the tyrannical Lord Ook and enforced by his Octobots and the master turntablism of DJ QBert, D-Styles, and Yoga Frog. Full of references to the new (virus scanners, internet, music downloads), and old (muscle cars, old video games, and schlocky science fiction), “Wave twisters” is a film that is a must for hip-hop and animation fans alike.

results.title: Wave particle duality
results.brief_description: Introduces and discusses the dual nature of light and matter and traces the development of the theory of wave-particle duality. A demonstration showing beams of electrons and neutrons creating a picture of wave motion similar to light’s wave motion is also given.
results.description: Introduces and discusses the dual nature of light and matter and traces the development of the theory of wave-particle duality. A demonstration showing beams of electrons and neutrons creating a picture of wave motion similar to light’s wave motion is also given.

results.title: Watts Library reaches out
results.creator_credit: Dennis E. Lew, Barbara H. Clark and ACI Films
results.brief_description: Librarianship is more than just cataloguing and handling books. In the Watts Branch of Los Angeles Public Library, librarians try every avenue to reach and help the community.

results.title: Wattle ballad. No. 1. My old black billy
results.brief_description: The song of the swagman who intends to “stick to me sensible, indispensable, old black billy”, sung by male voices and illustrated by shots of the swagman’s life. Arranged and sung by The Ramblers. Cast features Jock Levy.

results.title: Watt's last voyage
results.creator_credit: Brian Davies and University of Melbourne. Film Society
results.brief_description: A tale told with humour and pathos; a yarn spun between decks about an old salt whose bitter experiences one friendless dawn persuade him to abandon wayfaring for wading. Cast includes Graeme Blundell, Robin Laurie, John Wregg.

results.title: Waterworld
results.brief_description: A ridiculed adaptation of the Kevin Costner vehicle Waterworld, which translated the Mad Max narrative from the desert to the sea.

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

results.description: The sun. For millions of years the source of life. But for one planet the source of it’s demise. The temperature climbed, the vast pools of ice at it’s poles melted, and the oceans rose. Centuries later, few people remained on this planet, once called Earth. A lone mariner sails the expanse of water, trading to survive. For survival, is all these people do, in this place they know only as Waterworld.
description_for_label: The sun. For millions of years the source of life. But for one planet the source of it’s demise. A lone mariner sails the expanse of water, trading to survive. For survival, is all these people do, in this place they know only as Waterworld.

results.title: Watership down
results.brief_description:
One dim moonlit night, a small band of rabbits leave the comfort and safety of their warren and set out on a long and dangerous journey after a premonition of a terrible disaster that will overtake them if they stay. None of them knows where they are heading, or the dangers they will face in their search for a new warren where they can live in peace. Adapted from Richard Adams’ modern classic.
Voiced by actors including: John Hurt, Richard Briers, Ralph Richardson, Denholm Elliott, Zero Mostel, Nigel Hawthorne, Michael Hordern, Joss Ackland.
